comment: Example environment variables for Lambda handlers
description: These environment variables should be configured in the Lambda function settings or CDK stack

TrainHandler.description: IAM role ARN that SageMaker will assume for training jobs. Must have permissions to read from S3 data bucket and write to S3 models bucket.

EvaluateHandler.description: IAM role ARN that SageMaker will assume for creating temporary evaluation endpoints.

DeployHandler.description: IAM role ARN for SageMaker endpoints. CONFIG_BUCKET is where endpoint metadata is written for the inference pipeline.

ScoreHandler.description: S3 bucket where current endpoint metadata is stored (written by DeployHandler).

StoreHandler.description: DynamoDB table name for storing scored transactions.

AlertHandler.description: SNS topic ARN for publishing high-risk transaction alerts.

MonitorHandler.description: SNS topic ARN for drift detection alerts. METRICS_BUCKET is where daily performance metrics are stored.

notes.deployment: These environment variables are automatically configured by the CDK stacks during deployment
notes.local_testing: For local testing, set these as environment variables or pass them to handler constructors
notes.security: Never commit actual ARNs or sensitive values to version control. Use AWS Secrets Manager or Parameter Store for production.
